answerText: they're all orthogonal [or word forms, such as orthogonality][10] For this type of random process, the expected value and autocorrelation do not depend on the choice of origin for time. Thus, its autocorrelation depends only on the difference in time and not the times themselves.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 8 | 14 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Name some things from mathematics that are key if you ever take an advanced course in communications systems. [10] To represent a set of M signal waveforms in a signal space of dimension N less than or equal to M, you would use the Gram-Schmidt process to generate a basis of unit vectors that have this property. Normal and perpendicular are synonymous with it.
